originalText.text:
The firefighter we met the afternoon of Aug. 7 was so nice and friendly. Thank you so much.
And the fire truck of FDNY Ladder 25 is so cool & unique.
The firefighters are all heroes.ðŸ«¡

originalText.text: Nothing by great things to say about this firehouse! 2 of their firefighters were in sight and both so kind. I asked to take a few pictures of their rigs - and was granted permission! Not gonna lie - Iâ€™ve been a supporter of all first responders since I was a kid. They matter and are immensely appreciated!

originalText.text:
@ Jeffrey Wolpert,
Didn't your real estate agent (if you had one) make you aware of the firehouse?

Firehouses are inherently noisy due to saws and other equipment being tested twice daily. Not to mention the rigs -
Pulling out with sirens and backing in with "beep,beep,beeps."
It's an incredibly busy place with some of the hardest working men and women in the city that put their lives on the line every day.

To place blame on the men and women responding to emergencies in YOUR OWN community is ludicrous. To doubt they are actually going on runs is just plain ignorance.

That being said, if you go down to the  firehouse, and politely explain your dilemma you'd most likely have a positive outcome.
Bashing them here isn't going to help, and it makes you look foolish.

Keep in mind that if the sirens must be used they will be.
Firefighters appreciate community feedback, and would like to hear from you albeit negative feedback. You'll be surprised to know how nice we are.

I am proudly retired from the job after serving my time.

originalText.text:
@ Jeffrey Wolpert,
So you realise the reason they are so 'loud' is because its their job to get to a scene as fast as possible, they want to alert not only cars, but people.. Also, fire houses dont just *Pop* Oop, theres a new fire house here? No, its been there since the 90s, 80s, 70s. Do research before moving somewhere, dont like loud noises? Move somewhere quiet. Also do you realise that the reason they are so loud is because they are going to somthing called "calls" Ya know, somtimes a fire, or a water leak, or a collapse.

originalText.text: Firefighter Diogenes is the best firefighter ever. He saved my apartment last week. Thank you FDNY and Dio
